{"step_by_step_thinking": "Clavulanic acid is a beta-lactamase inhibitor. Beta-lactamases are enzymes produced by bacteria that provide resistance to beta-lactam antibiotics like ampicillin. By inhibiting these enzymes, clavulanic acid allows the antibiotic to work more effectively. Therefore, it does not specifically increase the effectiveness against gram-negative or gram-positive organisms, nor does it have any known effect on delta lactamase producing organisms.", "answer_choice": "B. Inhibition of β-lactamases"}
